name: Tiny Slick Berserker - Barbarian 15 / Rogue 19 / Fighter 6
author: Maximillian Kane

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hail, mighty ECBers!

I come to you today with another build that has been in the works for some time now. I like the idea of a scary little man a lot, so I thought of the Barbarian / Rogue combo for a Halfling as a good starting point. Here are the synergies I see in this class combo:

1- Terrifying Rage makes them run, then you Sneak the crap out of them as you chase them without worrying too much about getting hit. Barbarian Fast Movement makes it so that you always catch up unless they're Monks.
2- Rogues also have Intimidate as a class skill, which means you can keep Barbarian levels to a minimum of 15.
3- Rogue bonus feats allow you to take Epic Skill focus for "free", and also Epic Dodge, which is to deal with snipers or mobs of high-willed or fear-immune monsters.
4- Fighter comes in with the extra feats to get dual-wielding and EWS.

I like the idea of a berserker that moves fast as lightning while raging. I decided to drop KD because he's a halfling. To generate SAs early on, Darkness scrolls are the way to go. However, you should be able to go toe to toe with pretty much any single enemy or even a few mobs.

The whole idea is: you snipe at them from afar until they get close, then switch weapons and SCREAM! They run, you chase.

Anyway, should be pretty fun to play this guy. I didn't take Set Trap because the goal is to make them "run for their lives", not run towards you.

At first glance, it may look as though STR is the best way to go for this build, which is what most of the similar builds go for. I, on the other hand, went for a different approach. With 10d6 SA damage and ITWF, STR for me is just overkill. You become better at something you're already very good at. But what if you're facing a Paladin, or anyone with a Clarity potion, or even someone with high Will saves? That's where ED comes in. If you can sneak them, then you have no problem being a DEX toon, and if you can't, you can very well stand toe to toe with them with ED and Expertise. Options, I like to have options.

Anyway, here's the scariest most agile little man on Faerun: The Tiny Slick Berserker!

Maximillian Kane wrote:
Disable Trap 43(45), Hide 43(53), Intimidate 43(52), Listen 43(44), Move Silently 43(55), Open Lock 2(12), Spellcraft 18(20), Tumble 40(50), UMD 41(40)


 
Another build missing the skill allotment schedule. *s*

There will be a -20% XP penalty from level 19 to the end (22 levels).

In this build, the Disable Trap skill has enough ranks to disarm Epic traps.  Unfortunately, this toon will never spot them (i.e. DC 43 to detect). A minimum Search rating of 23 is needed and lots of patient standing around besides.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Not only that, but no Discipline at all. Very barbaric!

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Stagmeister wrote:
Not only that, but no Discipline at all. Very barbaric!
That's a "Max-ism", Stagmeister.  He felt that pouring ranks into Discipline for any build design other than one focused on strength was ill-spent.  I don't happen to agree but it is a common convention adhered to by some toon builders, other than Max, as well.  As long as there is a suitable dump class available to cap it, I try to save enough points to keep it as high as possible.

I suspect he is figuring that Terrifying Rage will keep all melee opponents at a safe distance since the save is bugged.  Well, if the server didn't fix it, that is.  No need for discipline if no foe can close in enough to apply a special attack. I recommend avoiding combat with any pally, though.  Aura of Courage is the only fear immunity effect not negated by the bugged script so will waltz right through the rage aura and attack with impunity.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Well that's fine and well, but how's he going to stay alive until L33? Get knocked on his arse and hope everyone forgets about him? There's nothing to suggest decent ranged ability early on, and who's going to want to travel with someone who simply pops behind a rock then picks up others' hard-earned xp?

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content: Hey, Stag! Well, that depends on where you play, but a dex-based Epic-dodger should always have a higher AC than discipline score, so discipline is kinda useless.
